#ButtonCmd: program name associated with button management
#ScreenCmd_: pgm dispos: MyChronoGPS_OLED MyChronoGPS_LCD MyChronoGPS_TE2in13V3 MyChronoGPS_Nextion_Display
#GPSCmd: program name associated with GPS management
#SerialRate: GPS data transfer rate via serial port (between 4800 and 115200 bauds)
#SimuCmd: program name associated with GPS simulator
#TimeZone: number to be added to UTC time to obtain local time
#ButtonNumber: number of buttons associated with MyChronoGPS (from 0 to 3)
#ButtonNumber_: if there is no button, then GpsChronoMode should be automatic
#ButtonNumber__: 2 buttons is needed to have GpsChronoMode manual
#GpsChronoMode__: 2=choose the circuit whose finish line you have crossed from the database
#TrackExt: track file extension, if absent or blank, search for track-~.json files
#TrackProximity: distance from which to search for a track (mode auto 2)
#TrackAcqTime: if there is no track, acquisition time (in seconds) to determine the line automatically (0 = 1 hour)
#GpsTrackerEcoMode: tracker data acquisition frequency. 0=OFF (acquisition=GPS frequency), 1=ON(1 acquisition/second)
#TravelTrackingTime: time (in seconds) between each acquisition in Travel mode (>=1)
#SpeedOmeter: in READY mode, speed above which only the tachometer is displayed
#FreezeTime: time (in seconds) beyond which the stopwatch is suspended (only in auto stopwatch mode)
#SleepTime: time (in seconds) beyond which the stopwatch is stopped (only in auto stopwatch mode)
#CoordsPrecision: precision (number of digits after the decimal point) of gps coordinates
#ComputeModeEco: activation of Eco mode for time events. 0=OFF (normal mode), 1=ON (Eco mode)
#UseStopwatchDisplayByILS: use of an ILS stopwatch display. 0=NO, 1=YES
#UseDBTrack: Using the circuit database to search for tracks 0=NO, 1=YES (default=1)
#AutoTrackMode: Automatic determination of a start/finish line. 0=NO, 1=YES (default=1)
#LED1_GPIO_PIN: yellow LED associated with Button1 and pitlane warning (default=4)
#LED2_GPIO_PIN: red LED associated with ILS Control (default=16)
#LED3_GPIO_PIN: green LED associated with Chrono Control (default=18)
#LED4_GPIO_PIN: blue LED associated with GPS Control (default=16)
